timeline.bodyText:
From check description
This check will log a violation if using the @inheritDoc tag on a method that is not valid (ex: private, or static method).
Please add examples to show this
timeline.author: strkkk

timeline.bodyText: Violation for test2 is "no override", but for private and static methods violation will be different. Please add violation comments to show it for all examples above.
timeline.author: strkkk

timeline.bodyText:
Doc for this property says that
This property will only check classes, interfaces, etc. that do not contain the extends or implements keyword or are not anonymous classes.
please add here comment why this is not cause violation
timeline.author: strkkk

timeline.bodyText: not be I guess it should be should not be

replies.bodyText: sorry, not be is incorrect, which causes a mistake. I think should be annotated with @Override is correct and is what I want to express
